abstract: Aging Korean enclaves in the Bronx are struggling with population decline, financial hardship, poor local education and high rate of crime; trend is highlighted in traditionally Korean neighborhood of Beford Park, where those who were able have moved on to nicer areas, while seniors and the poor were left behind; borough's Korean population has declined to 2,214 in 2013 from 5,166 in 1990.
lead_paragraph: The Korean population in the borough has been declining, and the center, in Bedford Park, which offers translation and other services, has been losing members.

headline.main: Bronx Koreans Cope as Their Population Shrinks
